key_risks: Product liability lawsuits alleging hair damage, hair loss, and scalp irritation
Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on third-party manufacturers and global disruptions
Intense market competition in the premium hair care sector
Regulatory and legal risks from varying global regulations and ongoing lawsuits
controversies: Multiple lawsuits, including *Michelle Albahae et al v. Olaplex Holdings, Inc et al*, alleging product-related harm
Declining consumer and investor confidence following slow response to complaints and CEO resignation
environmental_issues: Commitment to sustainability initiatives, including sustainable packaging and responsible sourcing, overshadowed by legal and reputational challenges
social_issues: Erosion of consumer trust due to allegations of hair damage and scalp injuries
Ethical concerns over the company's initial slow response to consumer complaints
governance_issues: Leadership instability with CEO JuE Wong stepping down amid declining confidence
Strategic missteps in responding to competition and consumer complaints

sources.title: Olaplex lawsuit alleges products cause hair damage, scalp injury
sources.snippet: Olaplex hair damage lawsuit overview: Who: A group of consumers has filed a lawsuit against Olaplex Holdings Inc. and Cosway Co. Inc. Why: Consumers claim Olaplex and Cosway falsely marketed certain Olaplex-branded hair products as being safe to use, despite them allegedly containing harsh and/or harmful chemicals. Where: The class action lawsuit was filed in California federal court.
